p: Typical calibration curves using surrogate Macondo oil in DCM are presented for all three instruments in Fig. 3. No attempts were made to increase sensitivities or otherwise improve performance of the instruments. Rather, all instruments were used with the settings as established in each one of the different laboratories. All three instruments successfully produced linear curves ( Fig. 3) with a high coefficient of correlation (>0.99). Best fit (R 2 = 0.9999) for the calibration curve of the Horiba Aqualog was a polynomial fit (order 2), but the correlation coefficient for the linear fit was 0.9991.
